qas.question: What was the territory of Tajikistan during the Neolithic and the Bronze Age?
What other culutres has ruled the area?

answers.text: Oxus civilization, Andronovo culture, Buddhism, Nestorian Christianity, Zoroastrianism, and Manichaeism

qas.question: What are some of the empires and dynasties that have also ruled over this land?

answers.text: Achaemenid Empire, Sassanian Empire, Hephthalite Empire, Samanid Empire, Mongol Empire, Timurid dynasty, and the Russian Empire

answers.text: Oxus civilization, Andronovo culture, Buddhism, Nestorian Christianity, Zoroastrianism, and Manichaeism

answers.text: the Achaemenid Empire, Sassanian Empire, Hephthalite Empire, Samanid Empire, Mongol Empire, Timurid dynasty, and the Russian Empire

qas.question: What year did Tajikistan become an independant nation?
What years did the war last through?
A civil war was fought immediately before what?
The civil war lasted from 1982 to what year?
As a result of the breakup of Japan, Tajikistan became what?
In what year did Tajikistan become a dependent nation?

context: The territory that now constitutes Tajikistan was previously home to several ancient cultures, including the <a0_0>city of Sarazm<a0_0/> of the Neolithic and the Bronze Age, and was later home to kingdoms ruled by people of different faiths and cultures, including the <a1_0><a5_0>Oxus civilization, Andronovo culture, Buddhism, Nestorian Christianity, Zoroastrianism, and Manichaeism<a5_0/><a1_0/>. The area has been ruled by numerous empires and dynasties, including <a6_0>the <a2_0>Achaemenid Empire, Sassanian Empire, Hephthalite Empire, Samanid Empire, Mongol Empire, Timurid dynasty, and the Russian Empire<a6_0/><a2_0/>. As a result of the breakup of the Soviet Union, Tajikistan became <b11_0>an independent nation<b11_0/> in <a3_0><a7_0><b12_0>1991<b12_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/>. A civil war was fought almost immediately after <b9_0>independence<b9_0/>, lasting from <a4_0><a8_0>1992 to <b10_0>1997<b10_0/><a8_0/><a4_0/>. Since the end of the war, newly established political stability and foreign aid have allowed the country's economy to grow.
